summary: This is an email chain regarding staffing and overtime at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for August 11-12, 2019. It includes an out-of-office notification and a list of vacant custody posts for volunteer sign-up by non-custody staff.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The sender of the email, likely a captain at the MCC, who is delegating authority to other staff members while out of office and sharing information about vacant custody posts.

events.title: Captain's Out of Office Period Begins
events.description: The Captain of the Metropolitan Correctional Center begins a period of being away from the office, delegating authority to other staff members.

events.title: Volunteer Overtime Sign-up for Custody Posts
events.description: Non-custody staff are invited to volunteer to work custody posts at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on Sunday, August 11, 2019.

events.title: Volunteer Overtime Sign-up for Custody Posts
events.description: Non-custody staff are invited to volunteer to work custody posts at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on Monday, August 12, 2019.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.context: The federal jail in Manhattan where this staffing email pertains. This is the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

keyFacts: This document is a routine staffing email from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York dated August 10, 2019.
It shows the facility was seeking volunteers from non-custody staff to fill custody posts on August 11 and 12, 2019.
The email's date (August 10, 2019) is one day after Jeffrey Epstein was found injured in his cell and two days before his death on August 11, 2019.
The document provides context about the operational staffing and potential overtime situation at the MCC around the time of Epstein's death.
No specific individuals related to the Epstein case are named; the only named role is a generic 'Captain'.
